Package com.agenarisk.api.model

Class Network

java.lang.Object
com.agenarisk.api.model.Network
All Implemented Interfaces:
IdContainer<NetworkException>, Identifiable<NetworkException>, Named, Networked<Network>, Storable, Comparable<Network>
public class Network extends Object implements Networked<Network>, Comparable<Network>, Identifiable<NetworkException>, IdContainer<NetworkException>, Storable, Named
Network class represents an equivalent to a Risk Object in AgenaRisk Desktop or ExtendedBN in AgenaRisk Java API v1.
Author:
Eugene Dementiev

    • createNetwork

      protected static Network createNetwork(Model model, String id, String name)
      Factory method to be called by a Model object that is trying to add a Network to itself.
      Parameters:
      model - the Model to add a Network to
      id - the ID of the Network
      name - the name of the Network
      Returns:
      the created Network

    • createNetwork

      protected static Network createNetwork(Model model, org.json.JSONObject jsonNetwork) throws org.json.JSONException, NetworkException
      Factory method to be called by a Model object that is trying to add a Network to itself.
      Note: loading node tables will fail if parent nodes do not exist in the model. In that case load all nodes first without tables and then use setTable(JSONObject) after all nodes, states, intra and cross network links had been created.
      Parameters:
      model - the Model to add a Network to
      jsonNetwork - JSONObject representing the network, including structure, tables, graphics etc
      Returns:
      the created Network
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if JSON configuration is incomplete or invalid
      NetworkException - if failed to load a network or node or if an object not found
      See Also:
      • Node.setTable(JSONObject)

    • createNetwork

      protected static Network createNetwork(Model model, org.json.JSONObject jsonNetwork, boolean withTables) throws org.json.JSONException, NetworkException
      Factory method to be called by a Model object that is trying to add a Network to itself.
      Note: loading node tables will fail if parent nodes do not exist in the model. In that case load all nodes first without tables and then use setTable(JSONObject) after all nodes, states, intra and cross network links had been created.
      Parameters:
      model - the Model to add a Network to
      jsonNetwork - JSONObject representing the network, including structure, tables, graphics etc
      withTables - whether to load node tables from JSON
      Returns:
      the created Network
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if JSON configuration is incomplete or invalid
      NetworkException - if failed to load a network or node or if an object not found
      See Also:
      • Node.setTable(JSONObject)

    • createNode

      public Node createNode(org.json.JSONObject jsonNode, boolean withTables) throws NetworkException
      Creates a Node from its JSONObject specification and adds it to this Network.
      Note: loading node tables will fail if parent nodes do not exist in the model. In that case load all nodes first without tables and then use setTable(JSONObject) after all nodes, states, intra and cross network links had been created.
      Parameters:
      jsonNode - JSONObject with full Node's configuration
      withTables - whether to load node tables from JSON
      Returns:
      the created Node
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if Node creation failed (Node with given ID already exists; or JSON configuration is missing required attributes)
      See Also:
      • Node.setTable(JSONObject)

    • createNode

      public Node createNode(org.json.JSONObject jsonNode) throws NetworkException
      Creates a Node from its JSONObject specification and adds it to this Network.
      Note: loading node tables will fail if parent nodes do not exist in the model. In that case load all nodes first without tables and then use setTable(JSONObject) after all nodes, states, intra and cross network links had been created.
      Parameters:
      jsonNode - JSONObject with full Node's configuration
      Returns:
      the created Node
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if Node creation failed (Node with given ID already exists; or JSON configuration is missing required attributes)
      See Also:
      • Node.setTable(JSONObject)

    • getParents

      public Set<Network> getParents()
      Builds and returns a set of Networks, which are parents of this Network.
      Networks are connected with Links between their Nodes.
      So for two Networks Net1 and Net2 and Nodes Node1 and Node2, where Node1 belongs to Net1 and Node2 belongs to Net2, and Node1 → Node2, Net2 is the child of Net1.
      Specified by:
      getParents in interface Networked<Network>
      Returns:
      a set of Networks that are parents of this Network

    • getChildren

      public Set<Network> getChildren()
      Builds and returns a set of Networks, which are children of this Network.
      Networks are connected with Links between their Nodes.
      So for two Networks Net1 and Net2 and Nodes Node1 and Node2, where Node1 belongs to Net1 and Node2 belongs to Net2, and Node1 → Node2, Net2 is the child of Net1.
      Specified by:
      getChildren in interface Networked<Network>
      Returns:
      a set of Networks that are children of this Network

    • setLogicNetwork

      protected void setLogicNetwork(uk.co.agena.minerva.model.extendedbn.ExtendedBN logicNetwork)
      Links this Network to an underlying Minerva Network object. Should only be used while wrapping a new Model around the Minerva Model.
      Parameters:
      logicNetwork - the logical network

    • removeNode

      public void removeNode(Node node) throws NodeException
      Removes the provided node from the model, severing its links to other Nodes and then removing it from its Network.
      Parameters:
      node - Node to remove
      Throws:
      NodeException - if the operation fails

    • regenerateNPTs

      protected void regenerateNPTs() throws NetworkException
      Regenerates Node NPTs in the Network, in descending order of the number of ancestors a Node has, starting from the root(s) of the Network.
      Skips simulated and input nodes.
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if regeneration fails in the logic
